name: strawberry seedling production, in heated greenhouse, for planting | strawberry seedling, for planting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15364/documentation

This global dataset is a copy of the regional NL dataset, except for the following modifications.;The production volume represents the global annual production.;The geographicalCorrelation score of every pedigree matrix of was changed to '5'.;The comments below were part of the NL regional dataset.;This dataset represents the production of 1 strawberry seedling, under heated greenhouse.;Functional unit is one strawberry seedling at nursery.;50000 seedlings per ha.year are considered.

This activity starts with the nursery producing seedlings

Included processes: peat moss use, end-of-life and distribution to seedling farm, irrigatino, greenhouse infrastructure and energy consumption for greenhouse heating.
Not included are: fertilizers and pesticides application and transport from the nursery to the farm where the seedlings will be planted. 
This activity ends with seedlings exiting the nursery.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/013:Plant propagation/0130:Plant propagation

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The amount of the exchanges are copy from a regional dataset.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data are based on the main production of strawberry seedlings in the Netherlands. Technology: Plastic greenhouses, heated
For the strawberries cultivated in Switzerland or in countries north of Switzerland (Belgium, Germany, Slovakia and the Netherlands, the seedlings are produced in the Netherlands, in heated greenhouses. (Stoessel et al. 2012).
For the transport of seedlings to strawberry farm, 100 g per seedling is considered, including moisture and container (Stoessel et al. 2012).

flow.name: strawberry seedling, for planting
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/013:Plant propagation/0130:Plant propagation

exchanges.description: Literature data: Energy for heating assumed the same as for tomato seedlings.; Heating oil greenhouse for seedling production, per seedling  (Stoessel et al. 2012); Energy consumption for heating for seedling production: 5.9644E-3 MJ/kg.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: 50000 seedlings per ha, transplanted after 2 weeks (i.e. 1/26 of a year)
Calculated value: 1 ha divided by 50000 seedlings per ha and by 26 (i.e. seedlings are transplanted after 2 weeks). Note: greenhouse dataset stands for 1 m2 used over 1 year
